subject: Sexual Health
title: Skin and Acne
description: A fast breakdown of Skin and Acne for builders.

hook.text: Nearly 85% of teenagers get acne during puberty. Hormones are almost always the primary culprit.

buildup.text: Androgens stimulate oil glands in the skin to produce more sebum, which can clog pores.

discovery.text: Clogged pores become inflamed when bacteria multiply inside them, creating pimples, blackheads, and cysts.

twist.text: Diet plays a role too. High-glycemic foods and dairy have been linked to worsening acne in some studies.

climax.text: Proper skincare, diet awareness, and medical treatment can significantly reduce acne's impact on teens.

punchline.text: Hormones drive it. Science can tame it.
